action.action-desc: Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to make memorial headstones and markers available for purchase on behalf of members of reserve components who performed inactive duty training or active duty for training but did not serve on active duty.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Honor Guardsmen and Reservists Act.

section.header: Availability for purchase of Department of Veterans Affairs memorial headstones and markers for members of reserve components who performed certain training
section.text: Section 2306 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall make available for purchase a memorial headstone or marker for the marked or unmarked grave of an individual described in paragraph (2) or for the purpose of commemorating such an individual whose remains are unavailable.
An individual described in this paragraph is an individual who—

subparagraph.text: as a member of a reserve component performed inactive duty training or active duty for training, but did not serve on active duty; and
is not otherwise ineligible for a memorial headstone or marker on account of the nature of the individual’s separation from the Armed Forces or other cause.
